H0.text: Meters are the most accurate units for measuring the width of a pencil lead.

H1.text: Inches are the unit in which the width of a pencil lead is most accurately measured.

H2.text: Millimeters are the unit in which the width of a pencil lead is most accurately measured.

H3.text: Feet are the unit in which the width of a pencil lead is most accurately measured.

A4.text: Lead types are based on grade and size; with standard sizes being 2.00 mm (0.079 in), 1.40 mm (0.055 in), 1.00 mm (0.039 in), 0.70 mm (0.028 in), 0.50 mm (0.020 in), 0.35 mm (0.014 in), 0.25 mm (0.0098 in), 0.18 mm (0.0071 in), and 0.13 mm (0.0051 in) (ISO 9175-1)
